intro: Peschiera benthamiana var. myriantha, commonly known as the myriantha peschiera, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered white or greenish flowers. It typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is more commonly found in the wild.
